page.title: 05Small Farms
page.content: Typical of many of the farms in the area are Fordbrook, Torre Hill and Venn Farm. Fordbrook Farm is a small dairy farm of 40 acres made up of about 10 fields used for grazing and kale for winter feed. The herd of 20 Friesian dairy cows (without a bull) are used for milk. There are also a few sheep and some poultry. Originally the farm was a cider farm surrounded by its own orchards. Torre Hill & Venn Farms (totalling 500 acres) are mixed farms owned by Mr. Cane. The cereal crops of oats and barley are used to feed his live- stock. The livestock consists of about 27 cows and 1 bull (mainly Friesians), 150 sheep (mainly Devon Longwool and Suffock Crosses), and pigs (Welsh and Large White). The cows produce meat and milk. The sheep provide wool.
